intro: Fumaria ouezzanensis, commonly known as the Ouazza fumewort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, nodding yellow flowers and slender, branched stems. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, hot climates. Fumaria ouezzanensis is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and along rocky outcrops.
